com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities

Class ViewUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities.ViewUtilities

  • public class ViewUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for managing views in various ways Created by pmacdowell on 2017-07-10.

      • alterViewVisibility

        public static void alterViewVisibility(@NonNull
                                       android.app.Activity activity,
                                       @NonNull
                                       android.view.View view,
                                       int visibility,
                                       long millisecondsToWait)
        Alter a view visibility after X milliseconds
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity to call upon. Preferred method over excluding this
        view - View to alter
        visibility - Visibility View.GONE, View.INVISIBLE, View.VISIBLE
        millisecondsToWait - Number of milliseconds to wait before making alteration

      • setViewMargins

        public static void setViewMargins(android.view.View view,
                                  int left,
                                  int top,
                                  int right,
                                  int bottom)
        Set the view margins and attempt to redraw
        Parameters:
        view - View to alter
        left - margins - left side
        top - margins - top side
        right - margins - right side
        bottom - margins - bottom side

      • getViewMargins

        public static int[] getViewMargins(android.view.View view)
        Returns view margins in same order as setting (left, top, right, bottom)
        Parameters:
        view - View to check
        Returns:
        int array (always size 3) where all 4 elements match same order as setting (left, top, right, bottom). If margins are unable to be retrieved, will return array full of zeros

      • resizeViewToSquare

        public static <T extends android.view.View> T resizeViewToSquare(@NonNull
                                                                 T view)
        Resize a view to a square by taking lowest width or height and resizing to that
        Parameters:
        view - View to alter && return
        Returns:
        If successful, altered view. If not successful, passed view

      • resizeViewToSquare

        public static <T extends android.view.View> T resizeViewToSquare(@NonNull
                                                                 T view,
                                                                 boolean centerView,
                                                                 boolean removeMargins)
        Resize a view to a square by taking lowest width or height and resizing to that. Overloaded, takes in 2 new params to allow for centering and margin removal
        Parameters:
        view - View to alter && return
        centerView - Should the view be centered? If so, will attempt to center view within layout params capabilities
        removeMargins - Should remove the margins? This is useful if trying to resize something and want it to go to the edges. Note, will not remove the padding if that exists. If true, this will set all the set margins to zero.
        Returns:
        If successful, altered view. If not successful, passed view

      • getDrawnView

        public static void getDrawnView(@NonNull
                                OnTaskCompleteListener listener,
                                @NonNull
                                android.view.View view)
        Used to get a view after it has been drawn. If you are attempting to get view bounds or sizing and are noticing you are always getting 0 for everything, it is because you need to wait for it to be drawn before you can obtain these results. Use this method to get the fully-drawn view and use it however.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to pass back view on
        view - View that will be returned when loaded

      • getViewCoordinates

        public static ViewUtilities.ViewBoundsObject getViewCoordinates(@NonNull
                                                                android.view.View view)
        Get view bounds. Note! This will account for margins! If you do not want to account for Margins, please use the overloaded method: todo refactor in padding?
        Parameters:
        view - View to be checked
        Returns:
        ViewUtilities.ViewBoundsObject

      • getViewCoordinates

        public static ViewUtilities.ViewBoundsObject getViewCoordinates(@NonNull
                                                                android.view.View view,
                                                                boolean isADialog,
                                                                boolean useRelativeToParent)
        get view bounds
        Parameters:
        view - view View to be checked
        isADialog - For passing in additional option. Dialogs are measured slightly differently and should be measured differently than normal views.
        useRelativeToParent - If this is set to true, it will override isADialog (if that is set to true). This gets params in respect to parent view.
        Returns:
        ViewUtilities.ViewBoundsObject
